result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles C Butterfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  DNA surcharge paid in full from bond on file.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to frequent and random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.


Defendant to be subject to frequent and random testing by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete the Ho-Chunk Nation Healing to Wellness Court Program, if accepted into that program.

supervisions.notes:
To serve 1 year jail consecutive to 15CT52 with credit for 67 days served.
Consecutive to: Jackson County case 15CT52
A civil judgment has been entered against you for the unpaid Court ordered financial obligations on this case.

Sent Balance Inquiry sheet from DOC to Judge asking if civil judgment can be entered.

Defendant appears in person in custody from JASO with his counsel Keith Belzer.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  No corrections or changes notes by either counsel.  State agrees with DOC recommendation:  15CT52 for 90 days jail with 134 days sentence credit for both cases.  All other sentences ordered on this case remain as previously ordered and requests judgment for unpaid fines/costs.  15CF137 - recommends 1 year jail consecutive to jail term in 15CT52.  Attorney Belzer concurs with the DOC recommendation and makes argument for sentencing to the Court.  Working on resolving pending case 16CF132.  Defendant excercises his right to allocution.  Court orders on 15CT52 a sentence of 90 days jail; credit for 67 days served.  Sentence ordered on 15CF137 is a 1 year jail sentence consecutive to 15CT52 with credit for 67 days served.  Civil judgment will be entered after the DOC agent has notified the Court of the amounts still due.  DA Fox will contact the agent.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 15, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State for 15CF137.    DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State, 15CT52.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Belzer.  State did not receive the revocation packet.  Sentencing after revocation needs to be rescheduled.  Defense requesting it be rescheduled in about 2 weeks.  Need a 1/2 hour time block.  11/15 at 1:15 pm.
Atty Bosben advised that defendant had retained Atty Keith Belzer
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
sent to Judge Becker electronically 9/21/16.  JMM
from DOC

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.   Defendant plead guilty to count 1 in 15CF137 and to Count 1 in 15CT52.  Remaining counts, plus 16CF17, 15TR1422 and 15TR2423 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Prior OWI's confirmed with the defendant and Attorney Fredrickson. Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of OWI 3rd, and Poss. with intent - THC, contrary to 961.41(1m)(h)(1) and OWI 3rd, contrary to 346.62(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for probation.  15CF137 -3 years.  15CT52- 2 years.  33 month driver's license revocation and IID, 155 days jail, all but first 14 days stayed.  $2,072.00 fine and costs.    AODA, recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Participate in HTW court, if accepted into that court. 

Court ordered sentence withheld, 2 years probation in 15CT52.  33 month driver's license revocation and IID, 155 days jail, all but first 14 days stayed.  Start on or before 6/24/16 and 6 pm.  $2,072.00 fine and costs.    Pay monthly through probation. Alcohol assmt and DSP.    AODA, recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Participate and follow through with recommendations in HTW court, if accepted into that court. 

3 years probation in 15CF137.  Concurrent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Subject to frequent and random testing.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Participate and follow through with the recommendatsion in HTW court, if accepted into that court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Have been set for plea/sentencing.
Status conference on May 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant appears with counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing with the defendant for 16CF17  Court finds the defendant KI waives his right to preliminary hearing and is bound over for trial.  State files Information with same charges as in complaint.  Defense waives the reading and defendant stands mute.  Court enters NGP.    15CF137 is set for jury trial on 6-30-16.  SPD Fredrickson asks to have until tomorrow to possibly work it out.  Status on 5-9-16 at 3:00 for all cases.

Defendant appears with counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  State calls witness, Officer A.O., sworn, testifies.  Male party entered someone else's house.  He ID'd himself to me  Appeared very intoxicated, disoriented.  He fell and noticed he had burns on his back.  He told me had weed in the backpack.  Asked him again, "my weed" - 1 gallon plastic bag, smaller bags, digital scale, police scanner inside backpack.  Tested positive for THC, 31.5 grams.  Believed he was intending to distribute.  ID's defendant - record reflects ID.  SPD Fredrickson cross examines witness.  Police scanner was not on.  Nothing in small plastic bags.  Called medical personnel due to burns and disorientation on his back.  Did not make any contact with homeowners.  Deputy Wathke did.  No futher questions or witnesses.  Court finds there probable cause, bound over for trial.  State files Information.  Defense waives reading, defendant stands mute.  Court enters NGP on both counts.  Already have pre-trialed.  Defense requests one more status; working on referral to HCN Treatment Corut.  Court sets STC 12-21-15 at 3:00.
Preliminary hearing at 11-25-2015 09:00 am

Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Report for booking.
